t: Matthew 12
Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath
At*p that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath. And His disciples were hungry, and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.
And when the Pharisees saw it,*i they said to Him, “Look, Your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath!”
But*p He said to them, “Have*r you*r not*r read*r what*r David*r did*r when*r he*r was*r hungry,*r he*r and*r those*r who*r were*r with*r him:*r

how*r he*r entered*r the*r house*r of*r God*r and*r ate*r the*r showbread*r which*r was*r not*r lawful*r for*r him*r to*r eat,*r nor*r for*r those*r who*r were*r with*r him,*r but*r only*r for*r the*r priests?*r
Or*r have*r you*r not*r read*r in*r the*r law*r that*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r the*r priests*r in*r the*r temple*r profane*r the*r Sabbath,*r and*r are*r blameless?*r
Yet*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r in*r this*r place*r there*r is*r One*ir greater*r than*r the*r temple.*r
But*r if*r you*r had*r known*r what*r this*ir means,*r ‘I*r desire*r mercy*r and*r not*r sacrifice,’*r you*r would*r not*r have*r condemned*r the*r guiltless.*r
For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r Lord*r even*r of*r the*r Sabbath.”*r
Healing on the Sabbath
Now*p when He had departed from there, He went into their synagogue.
And behold, there was a man who had a withered hand. And they asked Him, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”—that they might accuse Him.

Then*p He said to them, “What*r man*r is*r there*r among*r you*r who*r has*r one*r sheep,*r and*r if*r it*r falls*r into*r a*r pit*r on*r the*r Sabbath,*r will*r not*r lay*r hold*r of*r it*r and*r lift*r it*ir out?*r
Of*r how*r much*r more*r value*r then*r is*r a*r man*r than*r a*r sheep?*r Therefore*r it*r is*r lawful*r to*r do*r good*r on*r the*r Sabbath.”*r
Then He said to the man, “Stretch*r out*r your*r hand.”*r And he stretched it*i out, and it was restored as whole as the other.
Then the Pharisees went out and plotted against Him, how they might destroy Him.
Behold, My Servant
But*p when Jesus knew it,*i He withdrew from there. And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them all.
Yet He warned them not to make Him known,
that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying:
“Behold!*pn My Servant whom I have chosen, My*ld Beloved in whom My soul is well pleased! I*ld will put My Spirit upon Him, And*ld He will declare justice to the Gentiles.
He*ld will not quarrel nor cry out, Nor*ld will anyone hear His voice in the streets.
A*ld bruised reed He will not break, And*ld smoking flax He will not quench, Till*ld He sends forth justice to victory;
And*ld in His name Gentiles will trust.”
A House Divided Cannot Stand
Then*p one was brought to Him who was demon-possessed, blind and mute; and He healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.
And all the multitudes were amazed and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”
Now*p when the Pharisees heard it*i they said, “This fellow*i does not cast out demons except by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons.”

But*p Jesus knew their thoughts, and said to them: “Every*r kingdom*r divided*r against*r itself*r is*r brought*r to*r desolation,*r and*r every*r city*r or*r house*r divided*r against*r itself*r will*r not*r stand.*r
If*r Satan*r casts*r out*r Satan,*r he*r is*r divided*r against*r himself.*r How*r then*r will*r his*r kingdom*r stand?*r
And*r if*r I*r cast*r out*r demons*r by*r Beelzebub,*r by*r whom*r do*r your*r sons*r cast*r them*ir out?*r Therefore*r they*r shall*r be*r your*r judges.*r
But*r if*r I*r cast*r out*r demons*r by*r the*r Spirit*r of*r God,*r surely*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r come*r upon*r you.*r
Or*r how*r can*r one*r enter*r a*r strong*r man’s*r house*r and*r plunder*r his*r goods,*r unless*r he*r first*r binds*r the*r strong*r man?*r And*r then*r he*r will*r plunder*r his*r house.*r
He*r who*r is*r not*r with*r Me*r is*r against*r Me,*r and*r he*r who*r does*r not*r gather*r with*r Me*r scatters*r abroad.*r
The Unpardonable Sin
“Therefore*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r every*r sin*r and*r blasphemy*r will*r be*r forgiven*r men,*r but*r the*r blasphemy*r against*ir the*r Spirit*r will*r not*r be*r forgiven*r men.*r

Anyone*r who*r speaks*r a*r word*r against*r the*r Son*r of*r Man,*r it*r will*r be*r forgiven*r him;*r but*r whoever*r speaks*r against*r the*r Holy*r Spirit,*r it*r will*r not*r be*r forgiven*r him,*r either*r in*r this*r age*r or*r in*r the*r age*ir to*r come.*r
A Tree Known by Its Fruit
“Either*rp make*r the*r tree*r good*r and*r its*r fruit*r good,*r or*r else*r make*r the*r tree*r bad*r and*r its*r fruit*r bad;*r for*r a*r tree*r is*r known*r by*r its*ir fruit.*r
Brood*r of*r vipers!*r How*r can*r you,*r being*r evil,*r speak*r good*r things?*r For*r out*r of*r the*r abundance*r of*r the*r heart*r the*r mouth*r speaks.*r
A*r good*r man*r out*r of*r the*r good*r treasure*r of*r his*r heart*r brings*r forth*r good*r things,*r and*r an*r evil*r man*r out*r of*r the*r evil*r treasure*r brings*r forth*r evil*r things.*r
But*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r for*r every*r idle*r word*r men*r may*r speak,*r they*r will*r give*r account*r of*r it*r in*r the*r day*r of*r judgment.*r
For*r by*r your*r words*r you*r will*r be*r justified,*r and*r by*r your*r words*r you*r will*r be*r condemned.”*r
The Scribes and Pharisees Ask for a Sign
Then*p some of the scribes and Pharisees answered, saying, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from You.”

But*p He answered and said to them, “An*r evil*r and*r adulterous*r generation*r seeks*r after*r a*r sign,*r and*r no*r sign*r will*r be*r given*r to*r it*r except*r the*r sign*r of*r the*r prophet*r Jonah.*r

For*r as*r Jonah*r was*r three*r days*r and*r three*r nights*r in*r the*r belly*r of*r the*r great*r fish,*r so*r will*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r be*r three*r days*r and*r three*r nights*r in*r the*r heart*r of*r the*r earth.*r

The*r men*r of*r Nineveh*r will*r rise*r up*r in*r the*r judgment*r with*r this*r generation*r and*r condemn*r it,*r because*r they*r repented*r at*r the*r preaching*r of*r Jonah;*r and*r indeed*r a*r greater*r than*r Jonah*r is*ir here.*r

The*r queen*r of*r the*r South*r will*r rise*r up*r in*r the*r judgment*r with*r this*r generation*r and*r condemn*r it,*r for*r she*r came*r from*r the*r ends*r of*r the*r earth*r to*r hear*r the*r wisdom*r of*r Solomon;*r and*r indeed*r a*r greater*r than*r Solomon*r is*ir here.*r
An Unclean Spirit Returns
“When*rp an*r unclean*r spirit*r goes*r out*r of*r a*r man,*r he*r goes*r through*r dry*r places,*r seeking*r rest,*r and*r finds*r none.*r
Then he says, ‘I*r will*r return*r to*r my*r house*r from*r which*r I*r came.’*r And*r when*r he*r comes,*r he*r finds*r it*ir empty,*r swept,*r and*r put*r in*r order.*r

Then*r he*r goes*r and*r takes*r with*r him*r seven*r other*r spirits*r more*r wicked*r than*r himself,*r and*r they*r enter*r and*r dwell*r there;*r and*r the*r last*r state*ir of*r that*r man*r is*r worse*r than*r the*r first.*r So*r shall*r it*r also*r be*r with*r this*r wicked*r generation.”*r
Jesus’ Mother and Brothers Send for Him
While*p He was still talking to the multitudes, behold, His mother and brothers stood outside, seeking to speak with Him.
Then one said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, seeking to speak with You.”
But*p He answered and said to the one who told Him, “Who*r is*r My*r mother*r and*r who*r are*r My*r brothers?”*r
And He stretched out His hand toward His disciples and said, “Here*r are*r My*r mother*r and*r My*r brothers!*r
For*r whoever*r does*r the*r will*r of*r My*r Father*r in*r heaven*r is*r My*r brother*r and*r sister*r and*r mother.”*r
